description: I’m deeply engaged in AI alignment and existential risks, concerned that advanced models might drift from their intended goals, so I monitor safety research breakthroughs—methods, benchmarks, and protocols—empirical experiments that reveal misalignment, policy and regulatory updates, and documented failures or accidents across sources like the AI 2027 blog and Guardian reporting to spot early warning signals. I’m also interested in quantum computing’s practical and scientific applications and their broader societal, economic, and ethical impacts.
userInterests: The user is closely following the Russia–Ukraine war with a specific eye on diplomatic developments and economic impacts. They want to track how negotiations, sanctions, and policy shifts shape energy security across Europe. Their motivation stems from understanding both the strategic and practical implications of these changes for European governance and market stability.

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Russian attacks on substations are ‘nuclear terrorism’, says Ukraine
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukrainian foreign ministry says deliberate strikes on civilian energy facilities violate international law as fears of a winter crisis grow. What we know on day 1,347

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Zelenskyy urges US to expand Russia oil sanctions
curatedArticles.trailText: At a meeting with European leaders, the Ukrainian president also discusses the supply of long-range missiles. What we know on day 1,340

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Energy war continues with strikes on Russian oil and gas plants
curatedArticles.trailText: Russian attacks hit coal mine in Dnipropetrovsk region and Chernihiv power grid; Trump flips back to accommodating Putin. What we know on day 1,335

curatedArticles.title: Trump sanctions have swift impact but will world stop buying Russian oil and gas?
curatedArticles.trailText: Analysts say president’s war on Russia’s fossil fuel revenues is a chance to bring peace to Ukraine and profit to US

curatedArticles.title: ‘A punch in the face’: Germany’s dash for gas raises questions over climate targets
curatedArticles.trailText: Plans for a fossil fuel project in Wadden Sea nature reserve have angered local people and campaigners, as political enthusiasm for renewables wanes

curatedArticles.title: European leaders near deal to use frozen Russian assets for Ukraine
curatedArticles.trailText: Plans to secure loan with Russian funds ‘moving to happy resolution’, says Polish foreign minister

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Zelenskyy visits troops near embattled Pokrovsk
curatedArticles.trailText: Deep Ukrainian drone strikes hit petrochemical plant 1,300km inside Russia and Lukoil refinery east of Moscow. What we know on day 1,351

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: Moscow under drone siege for third night running
curatedArticles.trailText: EU edges towards using ‘reparations loan’ using Russian frozen assets; Kremlin pressing ahead with year-round conscription. What we know on day 1,344

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine war briefing: US reportedly mulling further sanctions on Russia that could hit banking sector
curatedArticles.trailText: Trump said he would not schedule any talks with Putin unless it was clear that the Russian leader was serious about ending the war. What we know on day 1,341

curatedArticles.title: Ukraine wants US to stay involved, says Zelenskyy after meeting western allies
curatedArticles.trailText: Ukrainian leader joined ‘coalition of the willing’ in London to discuss how to ramp up pressure on Russia

description: The user is personally curious about the fields of protein folding and nuclear fusion, driven by their potential to revolutionize healthcare through disease treatment and to provide sustainable energy solutions. This interest is fueled by the transformative impact these advancements could have on the future of humanity.
